strings.Value: "Who's Eobald the Insightful?"
"Why did you run from Irovetti?"
"Why didn't you send word in advance?"
"Is something wrong, Linzi?"
"Where will we find Eobald and his students?"
"Fine, we'll help your teacher."
"Get out. I don't care about you, or your teacher!"
"I said no."
"Why come to my lands?"

{n}A young man runs into the throne room. His clothes, formerly stylish and sophisticated, are torn and muddy.{/n} "Your Grace! Praise {g|Shelyn}Shelyn{/g} I made it here alive. I beg you, please help us!"
"Alondi? What... what in the Hells are you doing here?" {n}Linzi blurts out angrily.{/n}

"Oh, Linzi! I'm so glad to see you... Forgive me, Your Grace, for my lack of decorum. My name is Alondi — I attended the {g|Pitax}Pitaxian{/g} {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy of Grand Arts{/g} with Linzi. Our teacher, Eobald the Insightful, has been forced to flee the wrath of King Irovetti along with a group of his students. We almost made it to the capital, but we were caught. Only I managed to escape to find help!"

{n}Linzi opens her mouth, about to say something harsh, but she realizes the gravity of Alondi's words and interrupts herself.{/n} "You... What do you mean? Professor Eobald is in trouble? {Name}, we have to help!"
"He's a prominent researcher — a gatherer of myths and legends, author of many essays on history and literary theory... Any cultured ruler would be glad to welcome such a beacon of learning!"

"Professor Eobald was one of the wisest people in the whole {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}... maybe in all the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}! I knew the king would kick him out sooner or later. Like I told you, Irovetti isn't interested in sages and scientists — he just wants bootlickers and toadies!"

"King Irovetti's a jealous ruler — he doesn't intend to hand the title of the region's cultural capital over to anyone. He may have thrown our teacher out of the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}, but he would rather see Eobald dead than working for any of Pitax's neighbors. And if the refugees return to {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}, they won't be spared the chopping block!"
"Irovetti has spies everywhere. If our teacher had tried to contact you, we wouldn't have made it out of {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} at all."
"No. Yes. Not important right now! We need to save Professor Eobald as soon as possible!"
"Irovetti's thugs caught up with us near a giant tree — a sycamore, I think. If you go immediately, you should have time to intercept them!"
"Please don't let Irovetti get Professor Eobald! He's a shining beacon, you'll see!"
{n}Sniffling, Linzi runs out of the throne room.{/n}
"Thank you, Your Grace! You won't regret it! I'll hurry back to the tree."
"I can't believe Irovetti actually kicked out Professor Eobald... Well, it's his loss! We'll save him! Just don't go without me — I miss my old teacher terribly!"

"One of the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy's{/g} most talented students already found shelter here after fleeing the tyrant's wrath." {n}Alondi bows politely to Linzi.{/n} "Your books are quite popular in {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} — they're a living reminder that culture yet blooms beyond Irovetti's reach! We had hoped, Your Grace, that you would take us under your protection as well."
{n}Linzi winces but says nothing.{/n}
